body: I don't think this function is necessary. It's simply exposing an environment variable, but all environment variables already are available via Expression Language. You can simply use `${NIFI_HOME}`
+1 LGTM tested a few scenarios, @MikeThomsen are you good with me merging?

+1 LGTM, ran contrib-check and tested a few scenarios. @simonbence @turcsanyip Are your reviews complete? If so I can merge to main. Thanks for this improvement! It will also make it easier to do DB-specific things now that we have the Database Type property in there.

Just updated the Readme for dockerhub, this should probably be part of the release guide when doing the DockerImage.txt and Dockerfile version update, just to remove any confusion about the most recent version in Docker Hub. If the Release Management should be updated, I don't mind doing that as well.
@mattyb149 I'll do it.

> I don't think this function is necessary. It's simply exposing an environment variable, but all environment variables already are available via Expression Language. You can simply use `${NIFI_HOME}`

@markap14 It's useful!Thank you very much.

> Thanks, but we can't accept contributions like this without test coverage. Once you add that we can proceed with a review.

@MikeThomsen I find that it's not necessary. Thank you very much for review and I will close this PR
I got answer for my questions, thanks! LGTM

We tested this and confirmed it works. Merging. Thanks for the contribution!
Merged to main, thanks @turcsanyip and @tpalfy

@bbende @alopresto  Do we expect an administrator to configure an identity mapping for OIDC? I have tested OIDC and found that the full domain will be used in the nifi-user-keys.db and JWT. If we want administrators to be able to use a mapping for OIDC as well as kerberos, X509, we would need to apply mappings for the instance Bryan mentioned above. 

I am uncertain how this would affect logout - I don't know if we need to include the user's unmapped identity in order to log out.
`mvn dependency:tree` did not reveal any dependencies that would have L&N implications that I could see.
Let’s make sure we take an existing nifi with the old H2 Db and test dropping in the new NAR to make sure reading the old DB with the new H2 works. I’ve seen an issue before going to .200

I think we do want to allow it... the concept of identity mappings is independent of any authentication mechanism, it’s expected they are applied to the resulting identity string, wherever it came from.
Do you remember what that issue was?
@bbende I was getting that weird error with .198-.200, so I switched to .197 as a compromise for now.

Just wanted to check up on this PR.  We are using confluent and would like to use nifi, but looks like authentication is required.  Is this PR ready to be merged.  Looks like someone has tested and appears to be working?
Thanks @ndc629, the changes look good to me. +1 merged to master.
Created a separate issue to add/test OIDC identity mappings: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NIFI-7634.
Will review and play with it during the week...

Merging to main.

@qingweihuang It looks like you are building from the nifi-nar-bundles directory, but you'll want to run the `mvn` command from the top level in order to build all the dependencies, common modules, etc.
@patricker Can you change this PR to be based against the `main` branch and rebase against said branch? Please and thanks!
Thank you, @markap14 !

> I'm not change about github checks error.
> I run this check successful on my compute.

You need update DatabaseRecordSinkTest.java.   Add your ExecuteSQL property like this:
`
when(dbContext.getProperty(DATABASE_URL)).thenReturn(new MockPropertyValue("jdbc:derby:${DB_LOCATION}"))
`
This exception only gets thrown when you're pulling the flow from the registry. It would be better if it blocked versioning it to the registry in the first place.
Thanks Pierre. Fixed.

I think I messed up a rebase or something, this PR now has a bunch of extra commits. I re-submitted a PR with the changes requested:
https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/4416

Previous PR and comments here: https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/4377. As Joe emailed, GitHub actions are failing at the moment but I've verified the full build with contrib-check on both Java 8 and Java 11.

Have looked into this and indeed the issue is only present for azul jdk 8 262 and the failure happens on osx/linux and windows.  However, for other jvms such as adoptopenjdk it works just fine as it did before.  there is at least an inconsistency in the exception being thrown between these different jvm providers.  ugh.  Therefore I think the PR is a sufficient and necessary step at this point while ensuring only versions of azul 262 or later would have this test bypassed which is fair.
waiting for github actions/ci to do its thing but once good then will pull this in

NiFi Registry 0.7 is now released and available upstream. This PR can rebased against main and make use of the right version.
I retargeted the PR against main, looks like its already set to use the 0.7.0 version of registry client. I'll do some testing and if all looks good will get this merged.

@patricker @mattyb149 Noticed another issues with the cdc processor. We are getting duplicate records pulled from the processor with the only difference being the extract time. The duplicates are only happening on some inserts (operation 2).

This is for a ~12 hour span

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9344901/88191362-5d481b00-cc09-11ea-90fc-a23eca649362.png)

Sensitive column information removed.

Playing with it and it's awesome, thanks @simonbence for this pull request! Minor suggestions at the moment:
- ordering of the metrics on the UI side, I'd probably to group things together like: load stats, heap stats, repo stats, gc stats, file handler, etc. Not sure how easy it'd be.
- there is the total number of threads which is great, it would be nice to also have the number of threads being used from the Timer Driven Thread pool, the number of threads being used from the Event Driven Thread pool. That would be great. Not sure if we display two lines on the same graph, but if possible, displaying the size value of the pool (basically the maximum the value can be over time) would be nice. That would be particularly useful to see if the thread pool is oversized or not.

You're not overlooking.  Just busy on my end (as we all are).  I can bump this and get it done if it's holding someone up.  Likewise as always, if someone wants to run with it, that's fine too.

What timeframe is reasonable? I can probably kick on this again early next week.  Does that work?
Overall looks good, there was a failing unit test and a checkstyle issue, so I will add a commit on top of this to address those and get this merged.
No rush at all @taftster - if it does not make it into 1.12.0 that's totally fine. (And I don't expect 1.12.0 release work to start right now AFAIK)
Closing this PR for now.
Closing this PR for now.
This was previously posted as PR 4228 but the changing of the default branch name and other commits caused it to decay.
This has been rebased and opened as PR 4421. Closing this PR.
One commit didn't come over during the rebase. Resolving.
Looks good

I don't think we need to block versioning, but arguably we maybe don't need to store the param-context name on the shell process group that contains the pointer to the nested versioned PG, that is what is causing the issue. Using the correct param context from the actual nested versioned PG during import solves the issue.
+1 Looks good to me - ran full build, confirmed EncryptContent processor has new additions.
Apologies for the force push, realise now that wasn't a good idea. Was trying to trigger CI again since it looks to have encountered a transient error, but I'll ignore that in future.

Thanks for the feedback @pvillard31 !

I fixed the order of the metrics. This is something was working the same semi-random way with other history panels as well. Now it orders based on "ordinal" of the metrics. Looks much more organized

I also added the thread metrics you were asking for. I found no way to add multiple lines for the diagrams without serious refactors, so I hope it will meet your expectations the way it is. Furthermore I added detailed metrics about the given repositories as well (not only a summary for the given types)
Thanks mtien. I'm going to merge this.
This PR is ready for review & merge.
Also a +1 on this.
Closing this issue as it is OBE (PR 4416).
Verified both the existing negative behavior using the 0.7.0 RC1 (steps described in Jira) and the fix after applying the PR. Ran `contrib-check` and all tests pass. +1, merging.
+1 LGTM. Able to run a full build, confirmed I receive the exception message when password is too short or not provided.
Thanks all for the reviews. Merging.

Code looks good to me. Definitely solves the issue I raised in the JIRA. Thanks a lot @alopresto ! I'm a +1 but will wait until tomorrow in case someone else wants to review it, otherwise will merge.

@MuazmaZ - I know you looked at previous ADLS related work, are you able to have a look at it?

It seems the CI/CD machines are overloaded and/or lower performance than many of the developer environments. I'll ignore those tests with a comment that they can be enabled locally to prove the separation of the key derivation from the encrypt/decrypt operation.

@davyam Do you know that this CDC solution for PostgreSQL supports DDL events like in CaptureChangeMySQL, there is a boolean property `Include DDL Events`? But in the `nar` file that @gerdansantos shared with us this field is absent.
@alopresto maybe just convert them to integration tests which we dont run in CI/CD but folks do tend to run for validating RCs....?
Yes @pvillard31 I am reviewing it and will update today with comments/feedback
